articles.title: Paris’ Louvre museum to increase ticket price for visitors from outside the European Union
articles.description: PARIS (AP) — Paris’ Louvre museum has approved a ticket hike from 22 to 32 euros ($25 to 37) for non-European visitors from January to help finance an overhaul of the building whose degradation has been exposed by the Oct. 19 crown jewels heist. articles.title: Ottawa Food Bank shouldn't waste time asking politicians for help | Opinion
articles.description: Randall Denley: That the food bank has been able to handle a huge influx is a tribute to donors and volunteers. But its success undermines the urgency for governments to act.

articles.title: A strange ancient foot reveals a hidden human cousin
articles.description: Researchers have finally assigned a strange 3.4-million-year-old foot to Australopithecus deyiremeda, confirming that Lucy’s species wasn’t alone in ancient Ethiopia. This hominin had an opposable big toe for climbing but still walked upright in a distinct style. Isotope tests show it ate different

articles.title: Israeli forces kill at least 13 in southern Syria raid, officials and residents say
articles.description: Israeli forces in southern Syria raided a village and opened fire when they were confronted by residents on Friday, killing at least 13, Syrian officials said, as Israel fights on a number of fronts while the shaky ceasefire in Gaza moves forward. articles.title: Scientists uncover the brain’s hidden learning blocks
articles.description: Princeton researchers found that the brain excels at learning because it reuses modular “cognitive blocks” across many tasks. Monkeys switching between visual categorization challenges revealed that the prefrontal cortex assembles these blocks like Legos to create new behaviors. This flexibility exp

articles.title: Hodgson says it’s ‘premature’ to draw conclusions about B.C. tanker ban fate
articles.description: Federal Energy and Natural Resources Minister Tim Hodgson says it’s “premature” for anyone to draw conclusions regarding the potential removal, or adjustment, of the West Coast tanker ban, since no pipeline route has been mapped out to bring oil from Alberta to the B.C. coastline.
